title: The Gary Null Show

Jorgen Randers is a professor of climate change studies at the Norwegian School of Business in Oslo Norway, where he specializes in the future of climate change and sustainable development.
He has served on the boards of several corporations and is a sustainability consultant for the Norwegian government’s Commission on Low Emissions to reduce greenhouse gases.
In the 90s he served as the deputy director general of the World Wildlife Fund International.
He did is undergraduate work at the University of Oslo and received his doctorate from MIT’s Sloan School of Management.
Prof.
Randers is perhaps best known internationally for his co-authored 1972 publication of the controversial study “Limits of Growth’, which utilized system’s analysis to predict the state of the world in 2012.
While mostly discredited at the time of its publication, the study has become increasingly prophetic in its accuracy and has stirred renewed interest.
A new futurist analysis looking at the world in 2052, and commemorating the 40th anniversary the original report, has just been published – “2052: A Global Forecast for the Next Forty Years.”
